entry.title: Activities in IYPT
entry.content:
I have been in a club about physics called IYPT since the new semester started. The project our group focus on is about hand helicopter,which is a big challenge for us.

刚入学就参加了叫作IYPT的物理社团。我们小组研究的主题是竹蜻蜓（手提直升机），对于我们来说是一个巨大的挑战。

*The theme is like this: a simple hand helicopter can be made by attaching rotor blades to one end of a vertical stick. The helicopter moves upwards when the stick is twisted at a high enough speed and let go. Investigate how the relevant parameters affect the lift-off and the maximum height.**

题目是这样的：一架简单的手提直升机可以通过将旋翼叶片固定在垂直杆的一端制作而成。当垂直杆以足够高的速度旋转时，松开手，手提直升机就会起飞。探究相关参数对起飞和飞行最大高度的影响。

All of our group member feel confused about the project when we first read it .The area it is involved is far beyond our level. we made a plan of clear division of work,then discussed the type of hand helicopter we should buy on the Internet. Later we searched essays in both Chinese and English ,most of them are written by college students,then learn the professional formula and words by ourselves. These work was all done in after-class time. Then in the club time of second week,we did a couple groups of contrastive experiment and got some useful data.

所有的组员都对这个课题感到无比困惑，因为它超出了我们的知识范围。很快我们做了详细的分工，然后讨论应该在网上买什么样类型的竹蜻蜓。然后我们又去搜索了大学生写的关于空气动力学的学术论文，并自学其中的专业公式和词汇。这些都是在课余时间做的事情。在第二次的社团课上，我们做了几组对比实验并得到了有用的数据。

These are the whole process since these two weeks. Although we did not do too much,but the confusion when first reading the theme is gone , and the experimental goal is more clearly .We all gain valuable experience –the awareness of the important of teamwork,for any wrong division of work will absolutely leads to failure.

这些是两周以来IYPT社团的进展。虽然工作量不是很大，但是看到课题时的一头雾水已经几乎消散，实验目标渐渐明晰。我们也从中得到了宝贵的经验——意识到了团队合作的重要，因为任何一个人工作量太大或者太小都会影响事情的成功与失败。

Hope my group will be success step by step.

希望我的小组一步步走向成功。

entry.title: British educational system
entry.content:
I did a research about British educational system recently. Here is my mind map for the research.

Here is my research.

Britain has a long history of educating. Its education system has undergone hundreds of years of evolution, which is quite complete and complex, and has great flexibility. Generally speaking, It is divided into three stages :Compulsory Education, Further Education, and Higher Education. The differences between Chinese and British education systems make it impossible for students of the two countries to match each other in terms of age and academic level. Therefore, when considering studying in the UK, Chinese students must fully understand the differences between the two education systems and accurately determine where their level is in the UK education system. In order to choose appropriate courses and arrange reasonable study plan according to their own characteristics.

\Compulsory Education**

●The first stage is from 5-7 years old called the kindergarten education.

●The second stage is from 7-11 years old called primary education.

●The third stage is from 11-16 years old called secondary education.

The period of compulsory education prescribed by law is between the ages of 5 and 16. School-age children must attend school, and the State is responsible for the necessary tuition fees, books and necessary supplies.

The GCSE is the diploma obtained after completing the last two years of Secondary Education. The number of Chinese students studying at GCSE is small, and is only suitable for students under 16.

\Methods of marking**

Grade A* (A good result of exceptional quality)

Grade A (The higher grades needed for further and higher education)

Grade B

Grade C

Grade D (Regarded as average grades-a good base from which to grow)

Grade E

Grade F (The lower, but still useful,grades of achievement )

Grade G

Ungraded (Unfortunately, no score )

●**The fourth stage (further education)**

16-18 years old is a senior middle school or college preparatory class, which is the transition period from middle school to university, also known as continuing education stage, mainly includes academic direction and career direction study. Students who complete the preparatory courses mainly take the General Certificate of Education (Advanced Level).In addition to take the GCE-A level, vocational school students take the GNVQ (General National Vocational Qualification).

\Further education**

Further education is the most exciting part of the UK education system. It is also a crucial stage for Chinese high school students to study in the UK. Students in further education generally fall between Grade 8 and Grade 9. It is divided into two systems: the academic route and the vocational route. Both systems are equally valued in Britain.

\Academic route:(A******-level**\)\

The full name is General Certificate of Education Advanced Level, which is an important stage of the academic course. There are more than 100 subjects in it. We tend to think of A-level as the basic course of university. Generally subjects are selected according to two principles, which are known as professional objective principle and proficiency principle.

\professional objective principle**

The three or four A-level subjects should be chosen around the major that the student wishes to study at undergraduate Level and his/her future career goals.

\proficiency principle**

A-level grades also determine where student gets into university, so make sure you take one or two subjects that you are good at.

\vocational route**

GNVQ is similar to the GCSE and A-level in the academic route. Students can arrange courses according to their own needs and interest,and can even work in the process of learning.

\The elective system**

The elective system is simple and is divided into three parts,the Foundation, the Intermidiate(is similar as 4 sessions in GCSE and generally takes one year to complete), the Advanced(is equal to 2 A-levels and generally takes two years t complete)

\Methods of marking**

Distinction =A/B

Merit=C

Pass=D/E

●**The fifth stage**

It is called the college education, generally from the age of 18. It takes 3-4 years (medical for 5 years)for undergraduate study to obtain a bachelor’s degree. A master’s degree usually lasts 1-2 years,and a doctor’s degree usually lasts 3-5 years.

\A bachelor’s degree**

Bachelor Degree includes BA-Bachelor of Art，BSc-Bachelor of Science，BEng-Bachelor of Engineering,LLB

\University of joint school**

It is similar to the situation in China where many universities have secondary schools attached to them. Joint schools are generally close in geographical location,usually located in the same city. The purpose of establishing joint schools is to complement each other in teaching facilities and curriculum arrangement.

entry.title: TO myself
entry.content:
To myself:

致三年后的我：

I can not predict what you will be in the next three years，but express my expectations to you instead. Three years are neither too long nor too short,however it may change you totally. After three years when you read this letter,let us check whether you become the one you wanna be three years ago.

我无法预料这三年间发生了什么，只能在此表达下对你的期许。三年说不长也不长，说不短也不短，也许它会使你有一个脱胎换骨的蜕变。三年过去，你看看，有没有变成三年前我想要的样子。

I hope you can be a member of your ideal university. Whether your goals will change and how many times it will be changed is unknown ,but please work hard to chase your dream. Wish you won’t let those who cares about you all the time down,and have a bright future which you have dreamed of.

愿你你能考上目标的大学。不知道你的目标在这三年间有没有发生变化，会变化几次，但请一定要好好努力，愿你以梦为马，不负众望，未来可期。

I hope you can be more confident in the next three years. Make more friends and join more clubs you interested in .Wish you get everything you want and full of energy.

愿你在这三年里做一个自信的自己。多交些朋友，加入社团。愿你的未来有求必应，不缺实力。

I hope you can be more maturer after this three years period of time .I know you deal with things irritably from time to time. Wish you be kinder to others and apologize when you do something wrong.

愿三年后的你能更加成熟。三年前的你总是暴躁的处理事情，希望以后的你，平和待人,即使伤着人了也要说对不起

I hope you can be proud of yourself and smile from the first to the end. Your aims will be more and more clearly. Don’t hesitate when meeting multiple choices ,just make a decision and walk towards. Hope you will have a pupil to depend on when tired,have the ability to handle all the situations,have a positive attitude when facing hard times. Moreover,always be gentle while be treated gently.

愿三年后的你，甘之如饴，所得归于欢喜。要坚信你的未来会越来越明晰。如果遇到了岔路口，也别摇摆不定，选择一条路义无反顾的走下去吧。但愿未来的你疲有所依，有高跟鞋也有球鞋，风雨后心上没有补丁。在温柔待人的同时也要被人温柔以待。

Last but not the least,I hope you balance your habits while complete your schoolwork perfectly. Now I keep only a few minutes’ enthusiasm sometime. But time flies,nobody knows what you will be like,including yourself.

愿你漂亮的完成学业同时兼顾自己的爱好，现在的我是一个三分钟热度的人。但时间还长，谁知道这三年间你会变成什么样呢？

I am still confused about my school life ,homework,friendship and so many things when writing this .No matter what decisions you make —-I am always here accompanying with you ,as past memory lives forever.

现在给你写信的我还在苦苦挣扎的迷茫期。不论你今后做出什么样的决定——我一直都陪伴着你，因为我是你的回忆。

Hope you are still the girl you want to be when you reread this letter in the future, with honor and heart that remains the same.

愿你归来，仍是少年。

​ 2020年的你

entry.title: hornbill
entry.content:
The hornbill is a peculiar and rare bird. The hornbill has a large head, a narrow neck, broad wings and a long tail. Their feathers are brown or black, usually with vivid white markings. Their body length is about 70-120 cm, their mouth is as long as 35 cm, and a pair of big eyes with long thick eyelashes, which is rare among other birds. Its mouth is hollow, which makes it lighter but strong.

Most of them live in the rain forests of Africa and Asia, and use holes which are picked out by woodpeckers as nests They often feed on fruit and insects for food. Every spring , hornbill in pairs choose caves in tall tree trunks. Generally, each lays one to four eggs at a time. The general life expectancy is about 30-40 years old, The longest can reach 50 years old.

There are 45 species of hornbill worldwide. Most of China’s live in western and southern Yunnan and southern Guangxi. In Xishuangbanna, China, there is a rhinoceros hornbill, which has been listed as a second-class national protected animal.

The hornbills are closely related to humans. Nowadays, they are loved by Sarawak people. They are regarded as sacred birds by local people. They are also regarded as a god by the Iban people of Malaysia, who celebrate Hornbill Festival every year.

entry.title: koala bear
entry.content:
Koala bear is Australia’s unique rare original animals. In 1788, John Price became the first European to document the animal after Europeans first landed on the Australian continent. Koalas soon got their first scientific name Phascolarctos Cinereus in 1816. Their English name comes from an English word meaning “no water”, because they get 90 percent of the water from the eucalyptus.

Koalas are fat, and their hair was thick. The length of an adult koala is about 70-80 cm, and the weight is about 10 kilograms. Their noses are big and round. Their forelimbs have very strong claws, which help them climb well. The male koalas weigh 50 percent more than the female, having a relatively broad face and small ears. The baby koala is only 2 cm long and weighs 6 grams. They must remain in their mother’s pouch for six months before they are fully developed.

Koalas spend most of the time in trees and almost all of their life in eucalyptus trees. They sleep most of the day and the rest is spent sitting. They almost never drink water , and they feed on eucalyptus leaves, which they eat a lot and digest well. An adult koala eats about 500 grams of fresh leaves a day. Although there are more than 600 kinds of eucalyptus to choose from, koalas just feed on 30 of them.

Nowadays, human activities, forest fires and climate change are the main threats to koala. As a result of the loss of habitat, the difficulty of restoring burned forests, climate change and the disease, the population of Koala in Australia has declined significantly. They are included in IUCN Red List of Endangers Species.

entry.title: the feeling after attending FBLA

​ The feeling after attending FBLA

​ 参加FBLA社团的感想

Recently,I have been a member of a club set in our school called FBLA. Our first task is setting a virtual company to provide goods for the coming Food Festival in January next year.

入学后我加入了一个叫作FBLA的社团.我们小组的第一个任务是创建一个虚拟的公司为明年一月份的校园美食节做准备.

The activity sounds great ,but we actually meet a lot of problems. Our group has six girls,but at first when we discussed the name of the group on wechat ,I found some of girls were too shy to come up with ideas,so they kept silence. Our group leader felt annoyed about it,so she sent some words in the wechat group,mainly to encourage the teammates to be more active and tell us their thoughts. That really worked. The goods we would produce were soon decided,so did Plan ABC. Yesterday a questionnaire about the advice the students in our school would like to give us was also done. Anyway ,the work we do together is more and more efficient.

这个活动听上去非常有意思，但实际上我们遇到了很多问题。我们小组的组员是六个女孩，但我发现一开始谈论小组名称的时候，一些女孩因为含羞从不提出建议。组长有点恼火，然后在微信群里发了些消息，大概意思就是想让组员们畅所欲言。这方法奏效了。我们小组很快确定了商品并制作了方案ABC。就在昨天，为了调查全校同学对方案的建议，一份电子版调查问卷新鲜出炉。我们越来越高效了。

Here is the feeling about the teamwork.

以下是我对这次活动的初步感受。

  • Be active and always share thoughts when solving problems in a group,or the efficiency would be particularly low when all the teammates keep silence.

在集体活动中保持活跃，保持沉默只会让工作变得低效。

**

  • Be organized and divide the duty to each of the members. If several people deal with one together,that maybe a waste of time because everyone has a different idea,and the problem cannot be solved in a short period of time.

分配任务可以让工作变得更有条理。如果一群人做同一个任务，人多口杂必然会浪费时间。

**

  • Be manful as our group leader did. Because she pointed out of other’s mistakes, they can be corrected as soon as possible ,and then avoid the waste of more time.

要学习组长的果断。她及时指出了组员的错误并让她们立刻改正，这样很好地避免了浪费更多的时间

Hope we can finish the task successfully in the next four months!

希望我们可以一起在接下来的四个月里顺利完成任务！

Then here came a question about the facility,the equipment we found on taobao turned out to be useless. Therefore we made one by ourselves,and the material came from daily life,for example,the engine came from an electric fan. After comparing many ways,we decided to fix the hand helicopter on the engine by hot melt glue gun. The process was amazing ,and that was my first time using such a machine.

There came another question: How can we count the times when it was rotating and how to measure the height?Our tutor recommended an app ,but it was complex to use. At the end of the club,we used the photo function of iPhone to slow down the speed and saw whether it worked well. It came out that the result was amazing，and the times it rotated could be counted clearly.

From this experience,I learned a lot about how to choose a proper app to help analyze the data and how to use a machine that I had never used before. The two hours flew away quickly. In the end ,we not only recorded the experimental data,but also gained happiness and friendship between each other.

entry.title: lemur
entry.content:
About 1,600,000 years ago, Madagascar was a part of African continent. As time flew, Madagascar left Africa. According to the record of fossil, the first lemur-like animal appeared on the African continent 600,000 years ago before entering Madagascar.

There are twenty types of lemurs on Madagascar island, and because of the difference of environment and climate, their characteristics are different. They are generally small, with a dog-like face and move like monkeys. Their fur is brown and gray. Most of the time, they are gentle, careful and have a specially long tail.

They like enjoying the warmth of the sun, and it turns out that they are afraid of coldness. They depend on fruit on the island, and they care nothing but their families. When they jump from a tree to the ground in order to escape from enemies or find food or other reasons, it can be distinguished from normal monkeys, for they bend their back first then jump during movement.

Thanks to their isolated environment on Madagascar and islands nearby, they live without dangerous enemies. However, human deforestation is the leading cause of the lemur’s survival crisis, which has reduced the amount of space of them by 90 percent. Despite the terrible conditions, and important scientific value, Lexus still remain one of the least understood animals in the world.

Lemurs are listed on the IUCN Red List and the Washington convention CITES appendix I level to protect animals.

entry.title: Pandora's box
entry.content:
I wrote a poetry to memorize the unforgettable 2020.

Pandora’s box

2020 came on its cat feet

opening Pandora’s box secretly

disaster and pain flew out

making people suffer and scream

when the world was immersed in panic

a beam of light broke the dark

it lighted up the way and said

don’t worry

the hope is at the bottom of the box

After Prometheus stole the fire, Zeus severely punished him and turned his wrath on the mankind. He decided to create a new kind of disaster for them. Zeus ordered Herhuisto, the god of craftsmen, to make Pandora unique in the world and gave her a small delicate box a gift. Zeus let Hermes send her to earth and asked Erbimetus, brother of Prometheus, to marry her. One day after the wedding, Pandora opened the box because of curiosity, releasing hunger, disease, greed, jealousy, resentment, and the revenge throughout the land.

I soon came up with the story of Pandora’s box after knowing the theme of the competition was hope. In 2020, there was war, volcanic eruption in the Philippines, avalanche in Kashmir, locust plague in Africa, the collapse of Russia’s stadium, unknown disease in Nigeria, Brazil’s mysterious virus, breaking the Antarctic twenty degree… All this things were the disaster that was carelessly let out of. It made the death increase and mankind regard each other as an enemy. However what Zeus ignored was that the hope always came with disaster, and there will definitely be a day that the world is reborn.

entry.title: environmental problem
entry.content:
I made a poster about global warming to call on people to pay attention to environmental problem. Most content were summarized from my chemistry book.

Carbon dioxide enters the air through respiration and burning and it is removed by plants during photosynthesis. Burning more fuel and cutting down the forests increase the problem. Burning less fossil fuel and planting more trees would help to solve it. Methane is also another factor that cause global warming. it is produced by animals such as cows, and it is a by-product of digesting their food. It emerges from both ens of the cow. Intriguingly, termites are also significant contributors to the methane in the atmosphere. In addition, it is produced by the decay of food and other dead organic matter. It is produced in large quantities by rice paddy fields and landfill sites. Treating organic water so that the methane could be collected and burnt as fuel would help solve the problem.

The global warming may cause problems. Glaciers and polar ice will melt. This will cause a rice in sea level, and low-lying land will be flooded. The surface temperature of the earth will increase. Deserts will spread and millions of people will have less water. Severe weather events will increase in frequency, and hurricanes and flooding will become more common. In some areas it may become easier to grow food crops but in others it will certainly become more difficult.

After making the poster, I got something that went beyond my book. When people focus on development in economic, they should not ignore the problem about problem of environment, this includes air pollution, water pollution, light pollution and so on, which really have a great influence on mankind.

entry.title: giraffes
entry.content:
Giraffes are the world’s tallest living land animals, standing up to 6 to 8 meters, weighing about 700 kilograms. Newborn cubs can be 1.5 meters tall.

Giraffes can’t live on grass, they can only live on leaves. Their tongue is long and can be used for feeding. They live in forests and were widely distributed in prehistoric times, even in China. They are found only in Africa, and there are two species remaining.

The long necks and long legs can help them get cool. They live in hot savanna, and due to their large surface, this is good for emission of heat. Their lung capacity is large, and this is good for taking fresh breath and scavenging. Because of their long legs, giraffes have difficulty in drinking water. Giraffes drink water by straddling their front legs or kneeling on the ground, and are easy to be attacked by other animals, so social giraffes tend not to drink together.

Giraffes don’t sleep too much, typically two hours a night, and sleep can sometimes put them at risk. Giraffes spend a full minute getting up from the ground, and this reduce their ability to escape during sleep.

Given that some giraffes are increasing, some are declining and some appear to be stable, the most useful and appropriate actions for giraffes will vary depending on ecological stability, national policies and legislation. In 2010, they were listed on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species.

entry.title: Nanjing Hongshan Forest Zoo
entry.content:
When most of zoos in China had relatively primitive business models, Nanjing Hongshan Zoo cancelled animal performances and feeding. It began to pay attention to animal welfare and invested a lot of money in the improvement, protection and scientific research of animal living environment. However, due to the coronavirus, the income of the zoo declined greatly, leading to difficulties in the operation of the zoo. As a result of last year’s epidemic situation, the park lost more than $30 million in 220, and 40%of its revenue, ad lost more than 20 employees.

To deal with the situation, the Nanjing Hongshan Forest Zoo came up with an activity called adopting animals. It uploaded electronic animal adoption manual online, and called on people to choose animals. All they need to do is pay the fees for the animals they choose. They can get report of their animals twice a year, and have a close contact with their animals once a year. Everyone is excited and is willing to take part in such a interesting activity.

My class plan to adopt a panda, which is 3000 rmb every year, and I plan to adopt a leopard individually, which is 2000 rmb every year.

The activity is corresponded by many animal lovers, and I would like to be a volunteer in Nanjing Hongshan Forest Zoo. Hope the zoo can get through the crisis in the future.

entry.title: the proudest thing
entry.content:
I study in the A level center in the International department of Jinling High School. I am a hard-working girl and always manage to deal with problems well. I particularly do well in maths and chemistry, and I very much enjoy studying independently. When I meet any academic problems like difficult homework or content in the process of preview, I always try to solve the problem myself first of all, then ask classmates or teachers if I still don’t understand. I am also warm-hearted, because I adopted a kitten which was abandoned during the coronavirus outbreak. I am very energetic and usually spend about two to three hours doing sports every week. For instance, diving is my favorite, and I have always imagined going diving in the deep sea, exploring various creatures and observing unknown species. My friends always praise me for having a high efficiency when doing homework, and the ability to prepare for several competitions like UKMT, FBLA and AMC or activities at the same time and usually getting good results. Many of them like asking me questions about the content of the lecture after class, and I enjoy discussing their problems with them. We always work as a group to prepare lessons for the class, which makes me feel fulfilled and delighted.

The activity I am most proud of was joining an organization called MMUN ( Montessori Model United Nations ). My topic was about environmental problems in the Mediterranean and the impact refugees had on the environment. I spent about four months researching this, in particular, how the United Nations dealt with it, offering recommendations on how to improve the situation, writing my draft speech which had to be altered several times, and finally going to the General Headquarters of the United Nations in the USA. Over two days, my group discussed international politics with students of my age from all over the world. The greatest feelings came when everyone had their eyes focused on me as I was delivering my speech. Although I was feeling nervous, a friendly smile from the chairman removed my feeling of tension and anxiety when I stood on the platform, talking about my personal suggestions to resolve the problems in the Mediterranean. This activity was both exciting and challenging because I had the chance to debate topics in the adult world and let my voice be heard.
